Art. 4.19. 
Exercise of the usufruct of the estate
 Where the surviving spouse is entitled to the usufruct of the entire estate, such usufruct is established in accordance with the following paragraphs.
  The usufruct referred to in paragraph 1 attaches to the assets existing on the date of death, after deduction of legacies.
  It also covers
  1¡ under the conditions set out in Article 4.18, assets donated by the deceased and for which he had reserved the usufruct;
  2¡ on the terms and conditions set out in Title 2, subtitle 3, chapter 2, and by way of derogation from paragraph 2, assets bequeathed by the deceased insofar as the surviving spouse may request their reduction or benefit therefrom;
  3¡ under the conditions and in accordance with the procedures set out in Title 2, Subtitle 3, Chapter 2, assets donated by the deceased insofar as the surviving spouse may request their reduction or benefit therefrom.
